newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Compuware, others rally.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Compuware, others rally.

text.p: Compuware Corp and BMC Software Inc were trading actively along with many other stocks during the after-hours session as investors reacted to a flurry of quarterly earnings reports, traders said Wednesday.
"There are a lot of earnings and a lot of stocks are trading," said one dealer.
Compuware was trading 1 higher at 61 after reporting a profit of $0.31 a share before charges for its first quarter, compared with $0.16 for the same quarter a year ago.
BMC was trading at 60-1/4 against a close of 60-3/8 following its report of a loss of $0.10 a share for its first quarter against a profit of $0.26 a year ago.
Read-Rite Corp was slightly higher at 25-1/16 against 24-7/8 at the close of the Nasdaq's normal session and Baan Co NV was moving 1/4 higher at 76.
Another trader said stock prices were trading close to their close after normal trading hours.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 1,700 shares compared to 33,100 the day before, while session two had 3.6 million against 435,271.
